*div1 type="summary"* *p*P. S. Le Hicks to Austin, June 2, 1825. Asks what provision Government has made for granting land to participants in revolutionary struggles.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Alexandria */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="06-02-1825">June 2d 1825*/date_mentioned* La*/p* *p**person_mentioned*Mr. S F Austin Esq*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Sir Having been informed that you are able to give me information concerning the intentions of your *person_mentioned*Government */person_mentioned*in respect to those who served under the *person_mentioned*independent Standard*/person_mentioned* in the late revolution of the *location_mentioned*Mexican State*/location_mentioned*s and whether there has yet been any thing done in *person_mentioned*Congress */person_mentioned*concerning the *location_mentioned*grant of land */location_mentioned*to such persons I have taken the liberty of addressing this letter of enquiry to you requesting that you would return me an answer by the *person_mentioned*bearer*/person_mentioned* and also please to inform me what encouragement there is to a *person_mentioned*Physician */person_mentioned*in *location_mentioned*any part of your Province*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*I hope you will excuse my troubling you with these enquiries when you are informed that it is my wish to receive a remuneration for property expended for provisions and my services as a *person_mentioned*Capt*/person_mentioned*. for eighteen months and that it is and long has been my intention to settle in your *location_mentioned*Province */location_mentioned*if I could obtain a grant of a tract of land sufficient for Payment of Part of my sacrifices and good encouragement to my profession*/p*
*p*These reasons I offer as apologies and hope you will accept them as such and deign to give me an answer by the *person_mentioned*bearer Mr J Brown */person_mentioned*and you will greatly oblige*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*P. S. Le Hicks*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
